bug.author: krishnadurai
bug.summary: Second time apply of kfctl fails with 'current directory not empty, please switch directories'
bug.description:
/kind bug What steps did you take and what happened: Change directory into an empty directory. Apply kfctl through: <denchmark-code>kfctl apply -f /path/<config>.yaml </denchmark-code>
Re-apply with either command: <denchmark-code>kfctl apply -f /path/<config>.yaml </denchmark-code>
or <denchmark-code>kfctl apply </denchmark-code>
Shows an error on execution: <denchmark-code>Error: error loading kfapp: (kubeflow.error): Code 500 with message: could not load /path/to/install/dir/app.yaml. Error: (kubeflow.error): Code 400 with message: current directory not empty, please switch directories </denchmark-code>
What did you expect to happen: Second time apply should function when the directory is not empty. Anything else you would like to add: We would need to fix on the intended behaviour here since this should be applicable to other scenarios as well. I think one way of doing it is having apply command with the flag '-f' dictate whether to build or not, otherwise if '-f' is not supplied, we could assume the manifests are pre-built. Environment:
Kubeflow version: (version number can be found at the bottom left corner of the Kubeflow dashboard): Master branch kfctl version: (use kfctl version): kfctl v0.6.0-rc.0-143-g2395c5fc (from master branch) Kubernetes platform: On Premise Kubernetes Kubernetes version: (use kubectl version):
<denchmark-code>Client Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"14", GitVersion:"v1.14.2", GitCommit:"66049e3b21efe110454d67df4fa62b08ea79a19b", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2019-05-16T18:55:03Z", GoVersion:"go1.12.5", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"darwin/amd64"} Server Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"13", GitVersion:"v1.13.4", GitCommit:"c27b913fddd1a6c480c229191a087698aa92f0b1", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2019-02-28T13:30:26Z", GoVersion:"go1.11.5", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"} </denchmark-code>
OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release):
<denchmark-code>NAME="Ubuntu" VERSION="18.04.2 LTS (Bionic Beaver)" ID=ubuntu ID_LIKE=debian PRETTY_NAME="Ubuntu 18.04.2 LTS" VERSION_ID="18.04" HOME_URL="https://www.ubuntu.com/" SUPPORT_URL="https://help.ubuntu.com/" BUG_REPORT_URL="https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/" PRIVACY_POLICY_URL="https://www.ubuntu.com/legal/terms-and-policies/privacy-policy" VERSION_CODENAME=bionic UBUNTU_CODENAME=bionic </denchmark-code>
/cc <denchmark-link:https://github.com/swiftdiaries>@swiftdiaries</denchmark-link> <denchmark-link:https://github.com/jlewi>@jlewi</denchmark-link> <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kkasravi>@kkasravi</denchmark-link> <denchmark-link:https://github.com/yanniszark>@yanniszark</denchmark-link> <denchmark-link:https://github.com/gabrielwen>@gabrielwen</denchmark-link>

comments.comment: Issue-Label Bot is automatically applying the label kind/bug to this issue, with a confidence of 0.99. Please mark this comment with üëç or üëé to give our bot feedback! Links: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/marketplace/issue-label-bot>app homepage</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://mlbot.net/data/kubeflow/kubeflow>dashboard</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hamelsmu/MLapp>code</denchmark-link> for this bot.

I also ran into this. I think the problem is the hidden cache directory .cache. Can you run ls -al? Maybe we should update the error message to make it clear that this can include hidden files because the first few times I got this I wasn't sure what was happening.
